bank.title: Precalculus for Team-Based Inquiry Learning: PREVIEW Edition

outcome.title: Linear Equations and Inequalities
outcome.description: Solve a linear equation in one variable. Solve a linear inequality in one variable and express the solution graphically and using interval notation.

outcome.title: Applications of Linear Equations
outcome.description: Solve application problems involving linear equations.

outcome.title: Distance and Midpoint
outcome.description: Given two points, determine the distance between them and the midpoint of the line segment connecting them.

outcome.title: Absolute Value Equations and Inequalities
outcome.description: Solve a linear equation involving an absolute value. Solve a linear inequality involving absolute values and express the answers graphically and using interval notation.

outcome.title: Quadratic Equations
outcome.description: Solve quadratic equations using factoring, the square root property, completing the square, and the quadratic formula and express these answers in exact form.

outcome.title: Rational Equations
outcome.description: Solve a rational equation.

outcome.title: Quadratic and Rational Inequalities
outcome.description: Solve quadratic inequalities and express the solution graphically and with interval notation. Solve rational inequalities and express the solution graphically and using interval notation.

outcome.title: Introduction to Functions
outcome.description: Determine if a relation, equation, or graph defines a function using the definition as well as the vertical line test.

outcome.title: Function Notation
outcome.description: Use and interpret function notation to evaluate a function for a given input value and find a corresponding input value given an output value.

outcome.title: Characteristics of a Functionâ€™s Graph
outcome.description: Use the graph of a function to find the domain and range in interval notation, the x- and y-intercepts, the maxima and minima, and where it is increasing and decreasing using interval notation.

outcome.title: Transformation of Functions
outcome.description: Apply transformations including horizontal and vertical shifts, stretches, and reflections to a function. Express the result of these transformations graphically and algebraically.

outcome.title: Combining and Composing Functions
outcome.description: Find the sum, difference, product, quotient, and composition of two or more functions and evaluate them.

outcome.title: Finding the Inverse Function
outcome.description: Find the inverse of a one-to-one function.

outcome.title: Slope and Average Rate of Change
outcome.description: Determine the average rate of change of a given function over a given interval. Find the slope of a line.

outcome.title: Equations of Lines
outcome.description: Determine an equation for a line when given two points on the line and when given the slope and one point on the line. Express these equations in slope-intercept or point-slope form and determine the slope and y-intercept of a line given an equation.

outcome.title: Graphs of Linear Equations
outcome.description: Graph a line given its equation or some combination of characteristics, such as points on the graph, a table of values, the slope, or the intercepts.

outcome.title: Parallel and Perpendicular Lines
outcome.description: Use slope relationships to determine whether two lines are parallel or perpendicular, and find the equation of lines parallel or perpendicular to a given line through a given point.

outcome.title: Linear Models and Meanings
outcome.description: Build linear models from verbal descriptions, and use the models to establish conclusions, including by contextualizing the meaning of slope and intercept parameters.

outcome.title: Systems of Linear Equations
outcome.description: Solve a system of two linear equations in two variables.

outcome.title: Applications of Systems of Linear Equations
outcome.description: Solve questions involving applications of systems of equations.

outcome.title: Graphing Quadratic Functions
outcome.description: Graph quadratic functions and identify their axis of symmetry, and maximum or minimum point.

outcome.title: Quadratic Models and Meanings
outcome.description: Use quadratic models to solve an application problem and establish conclusions.

outcome.title: Graphs of Polynomial Functions
outcome.description: Determine the zeros and their multiplicities of a polynomial in factored form. Describe and graph the behavior of a polynomial function at the intercepts and the ends.

outcome.title: Polynomial Long Division
outcome.description: Rewrite a rational function as a polynomial plus a proper rational function.

outcome.title: Zeros of Polynomial Functions
outcome.description: Determine the zeros of a polynomial function with real coefficients.

outcome.title: Graphs of Rational Functions
outcome.description: Find the domain and range, vertical and horizontal asymptotes, and intercepts of a rational function and use this information to sketch the graph.

outcome.title: Introduction to Exponentials
outcome.description: Determine if a given function is exponential. Find an equation of an exponential function. Evaluate exponential functions (including base e).

outcome.title: Graphs of Exponential Functions
outcome.description: Graph exponential functions and determine the domain, range, and asymptotes.

outcome.title: Introduction to Logarithms
outcome.description: Convert between exponential and logarithmic form. Evaluate a logarithmic function, including common and natural logarithms.

outcome.title: Graphs of Logarithmic Functions
outcome.description: Graph logarithmic functions and determine the domain, range, and asymptotes.

outcome.title: Properties of Logarithms
outcome.description: Use properties of logarithms to condense or expand logarithmic expressions.

outcome.title: Solving Exponential and Logarithmic Equations
outcome.description: Solve exponential and logarithmic equations.

outcome.title: Applications of Exponential and Logarithmic Functions
outcome.description: Solve application problems using exponential and logarithmic equations.
